items.q: What is the theoretical temperature at which all molecular motion stops?
items.explanation: Absolute zero (0 K) is -273.15 degrees Celsius.

items.q: There is no gravity on the International Space Station.
items.explanation: Gravity is approximately 90% as strong there; objects fall at the same rate the ISS orbits, causing weightlessness.

items.q: Fungi perform photosynthesis to produce their own food.
items.explanation: Fungi are heterotrophs and absorb nutrients from other organisms.

items.q: What principle states that you cannot simultaneously know the exact position and momentum of a particle?
items.explanation: Introduced by Werner Heisenberg in quantum mechanics.

items.q: What type of chemical bond involves the sharing of electron pairs between atoms?
items.explanation: This allows atoms to have a full outer shell.

items.q: What is the name of the most massive officially recognized dwarf planet?
items.explanation: Eris is also extremely massive, but Pluto is slightly larger by volume.

items.q: What is the term for an organism's ability to maintain a stable internal environment?
items.explanation: This involves regulating temperature, pH, etc.

items.q: What law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction?
What organelle is known as the suicide sac of the cell?
items.explanation: It contains digestive enzymes that can break down the cell itself.

items.q: Who first formulated the germ theory of disease?
items.explanation: He linked microscopic pathogens to infectious diseases.
